text: Mšeno (; ) is a small town in the Central Bohemian Region of the Czech Republic. It has about 1,500 inhabitants. ==History== The Slavic people settled the town area c. 5th-6th century CE. http://www.mestomseno.cz/index.php?cmd=page&id;=268 Evidence suggests that in early times the place may have been called "Black Village" due to the many fires that raged there.http://www.hrad-bezdez.cz/mseno.php Whatever the case, the first recorded mention of Mšeno was in 1306, in a document signed by Wenceslaus III awarding the then-village to aristocrat Hynek Berka z Dubé; he, and his son after him, ensured the growing prosperity of the area. In 1367, Charles IV raised Mšeno to the rank of "town". ==References== ==External links== *Official website (cz, en, de) Category:Cities and towns in the Czech Republic
title: Mšeno
